title: Guarddog Rules Overview
description: This dashboard shows results from GuardDog scans across ecosystems like PyPI, npm, Go modules, and GitHub Actions. It helps spot malicious or suspicious packages based on GuardDog’s rules.

definition.content:
[GuardDog](https://github.com/DataDog/guarddog) is a CLI tool that allows identifying malicious PyPI and npm packages, Go modules, and GitHub actions. It runs a set of heuristics on the package source code (through Semgrep rules) and on the package metadata.

This dashboard shows results from GuardDog scans across ecosystems like PyPI, npm, Go modules, and GitHub Actions. It helps spot malicious or suspicious packages based on GuardDog’s rules.

For more information, see the [Guarddog Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/guarddog/).

**Tips**
- Use the timeframe selector in the upper-right corner of the dashboard to change the default timeframe.
- Clone this dashboard to rearrange, modify, and add widgets and visualizations.
